_field_custom.name: room intensity:dB#intensity of the room effect

_field_real.name: room intensity:dB#intensity of the room effect

_field_custom.name: room intensity hf:dB#intensity of the room effect above the reference high frequency

_field_real.name: room intensity hf:dB#intensity of the room effect above the reference high frequency

_field_custom.name: room rolloff (0 to 10)#how quickly the room effect rolls off, from 0.0 to 10.0

_field_real.name: room rolloff (0 to 10)#how quickly the room effect rolls off, from 0.0 to 10.0

_field_custom.name: hf reference(20 to 20,000):Hz#for hf values, what frequency defines hf, from 20 to 20,000

_field_real.name: hf reference(20 to 20,000):Hz#for hf values, what frequency defines hf, from 20 to 20,000

plugin._field_explanation: Use these values for WWise reverb. Above stuff will be removed eventually.

_field_string_id.name: Environment name#Name of the environment from WWise. This will be a DSP effect with Environmental Effect checked.

_field_custom.name: Dry mix value#0 to 1 with 0 being none, and 1 being full.

_field_real.name: Dry mix value#0 to 1 with 0 being none, and 1 being full.

_field_custom.name: Wet mix value#0 to 1 with 0 being none, and 1 being full.

_field_real.name: Wet mix value#0 to 1 with 0 being none, and 1 being full.

_field_custom.name: Player wet mix value#0 to 1 with 0 being none, and 1 being full.

_field_real.name: Player wet mix value#0 to 1 with 0 being none, and 1 being full.

plugin._field_explanation: This will override obstruction and occlusion if you set the cutoff frequency to a non-zero value. Use the individual classes' "forced lowpass wet mix" value to alter the mix.
